Text: FW Change of Control ProvisionsThere is no denying that these are difficult times and it is all to easy in this day and age to overlook the accomplishments that this Company has acheived in both business and the greater communities that it has served over the years Yes the financial impact has affected us all but as I look back over my thirteen years of employment and the multiple moves that my family has sacrificed for me I would no doubt do it all again because of the wealth that I have gained in the area of friends knowledge and work experience of being an ENRON EMPLOYEE I look foward to the future and in no way ever look down upon the past Always remember that great leader are defined in trying times and therefore I wanted to thank you for your Leadership The only help that I need is explaining all the complexities of what happen to my ever inquisitive Mother Original Message From Ken Lay Office of the Chairman Sent Tue PM To DLGAallenronworldwide Cc Subject Change of Control Provisions As many of you know I have a provision in my employment contract which provides for a payment of million per year for the remaining term of my contract in the event of a change of control of Enron The merger with Dynegy or a similar transaction with any other company would trigger this provision on closing Assuming the merger with Dynegy is closed within months as we expect this provision would entitle me to total payments of slightly more than million Many CEOs have change of control provisions in their employment contracts and mine has been in place since But given the current circumstances facing the company and our employees I have been giving a lot of thought these last few days to what to do about this payment Initially I thought I would use part of the funds for a foundation for our employees and take the remainder in stock and cash However after talking to a number of employees this afternoon I have decided that the best course of action would be for me to waive my right to any of this payment Therefore at closing I will receive no payments under this provision I know this action does not remedy the uncertainty that you and your families face But please know that I will continue to do everything in my power to serve the best interests of Enrons employees and shareholders I am still very proud of what we have built at Enron and I want to continue working with all of you to correct the problems and restore Enron to its rightful place in the energy industry Thank you

RE Alliant Request Cc Mike you are correct I just informed Chris sorry about the confusion My fault Original Message From Bodnar Michael Sent Thursday December AM To Sebesta Chris Cc Blair Lynn Semin Frank Subject Alliant Request Chris I was surprised to get your message when I got into the office this morning I tried to call you back several times this morning but your phone never went to phone mail In short we stopped our attempts to get the information Alliant had requested I thought Frank was going to let you know Alliants request was discussed after one of the weekend conference calls a couple weeks ago Frank Semin Lynn Blair and I I think Steve January and Terry Kowalke stayed after also discussed the matter because the IT Group wasnt having any success retrieving the data and indicated that any data that could be retrieved would not readily show if injections or withdrawals were allocated Each individual allocation would have to be reviewed to determine which activity injections or withdrawals was allocated The retrieval effort would have tied up our limited IT and Gas Logistics resources with little if any results Based on that the decision was made to stop the effort I thought Frank was going to let you know about our discussion and the decision that was reached I apologize for not following up with you personally on the matter

RE Zone Allocations Cc To help clarify a storage withdrawal reduction essentially created the same physical effect as would an injection during the recent storage allocations For example If the storage fields had a net injection on a given day of dthphysical maximumand at the am cycle an injection increased by dth it would be denied because of the physical limitations The same limitation would occur if a withdraw was reduced by dth creating a net dth injection at the am process because the same physical limitation existing Injections Withdrawals Net physical limitation Trying to reduce a redraw of dth would create Injections Withdrawals Net physically above the limitation and would be allocated The intraday process are interative that is FDD withdrawalsinjections can impact the interruptible storage availability during the intraday cycles whereas the am process is only a individual trueup and not interative with the other storage agreements Lynn and Chris would gladly schedule some time to help clarify these issues and I am sure it will be a lot more informative than my attempt here Original Message From Jeff Hicken mailto Sent Friday November AM To Sebesta Chris Blair Lynn Cc Bill Zorr Kelly Schneider Semin Frank Subject RE Zone Allocations It may be standard practice in your opinion but Kelly Bill and I have never heard of this or remember it happening to us Also EntergyKoch was completely surprised by it as well We just cant understand why you would call a reduction in a withdrawal an injection Your allocation is limiting storage injections and we were not making an injection Wed like to know where to find this in the tariff so we can read it and understand it better We pulled looked at the am process instructions on the web and it doesnt say anything about this What is really upsetting to us is were thought we were set up fine to be in compliance with the SUL and suddenly we couldnt do what we thought we had a right to do even though Hot Tap accepted the nomination On top of that no one from NNG called us to let us know that our nomination had been undone and the same thing would have happened to us on the gas day if we hadnt been lucky enough to have found it on our own We pushed the gas across to ANR but we are going to incur penalties from them as a result The other really strange thing is that during the intraday processes we can cut back on our withdrawal even though storage is allocated but you cant do it at am It just doesnt make any sense to us Sebesta Chris AM Jeff I am sorry WPL and IES are experiencing allocation problems It is standard procedure during a storage injection allocation the am true up process does not allow FDD withdrawal reductions or storage injections Many other shippers are also working hard to manage their business Other than getting truer information on your markets needs or finding alternate markets for your excess capacity I dont have any other ideas on how to address your zone allocations As requested I will add this item to our December meeting agenda Original Message From Jeff Hicken mailto Sent Thursday November PM To Sebesta Chris Blair Lynn Cc Bill Zorr Kelly Schneider Subject Re Zone Allocations Chris You should know that we are unhappy about something else now For the gas day you NNG did not let us reduce our FDD withdrawal nomination to zero in the am process like normal because of a storage injection allocation Because of this WPL is going to get hit with SUL DDVC penalties EntergyKoch who handles the IES assests was surprised by this as well and IES may incur penalties too We werent trying to make an injection we were just trying to cut our withdrawal to zero We always schedule a maximum withdrawal in the winter because we are always at risk of a zone allocaton just like we have been seeing lately Weve had conference call with Jean Blair and Jerry Wilkens on the topic We are also in trouble now for the gas day which we are current trying to figure a way out of You can add this item to our discussion topics when you visit Jeff Jeff Hicken Gas Trader AlliantEnergy Sebesta Chris AM Lynn as indicated in my voice mail Frank and I would like you to call Jeff Hicken of Alliant Energy He would like someone to explain why he is getting allocated at the zone level when he is trying to adjust his timely cycle noms later in the day to reflect lower requirements and what are his alternatives especially as storage may have a chance of being allocated Please call Jeff today He can be reached at Thank you Chris Sebesta Northern Natural Gas Office Fax This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and MEC OBAPlease review and provide any comments or suggestions Thanks fs

Account Receivables Cc The attached list are outstanding receivables associated with the Central Region group that have occurred prior to December I would request that these receivables get written off in order to clean up the books Total value If you have any questions please do not hesitate to give me a call

FW NNG October Chargesfyi here is another one Original Message From Gesell Tom A mailto Sent Wednesday November AM To Semin Frank Cc Kremer Todd J Woofter Mark D Putnam William W Subject FW NNG October Charges Importance High Frank Accounting has indicated our October invoice has some DDVC and IT overrun charges that our metering does not show Before we can pay these we would need you to verify the measurement of all of our stations Bill and his SCADA folks believe the untelemetered allocations are inaccurate and likely causing the DDVC and overrun I have asked our Accounting group to short pay the October DDVCs of and to also short pay the associated transport invoice for the IT overrun of a total disputed cost of Let me know if you need any additional information a brief recap of the disputed charges are shown below Thanks Tom Original Message From Chrisman Tamara L Sent Tuesday November AM To Mulford Troi Cc Badura David J Kremer Todd J Hebel Nathan P Gesell Tom A Subject NNG October Charges Importance High Tom NNG has billed MEC for the following Oct MBMtu Oct MMBtu Oct MMBtu Oct MMBtu Oct MMBtu all positive DDVC Charges at Total DDVC Charge is MEC is shortpaying this invoice by this amount On the NNG Transport Commodity invoice NNG is billing MEC for MMBtu at the overrun rate of MEC is to pay only the normal ft rate for this contract of Please short pay this invoice by

RE IES Zone D DDVCs Cc It is our objective to readprocess ALL customer charts going forwardNovember it was the intent at the time to only process the prior periods in October for MidAmerican and Alliant IES Interstate Power and WPS to address their immediate concerns If there is any confusion concerning this objective please do not hesitate to give me a call thanks fs Original Message From Anderson Gary E Sent Thursday January AM To Zadow Raetta Cc Semin Frank Neubauer Dave Sebesta Chris Dietz Rick Blair Lynn Floyd Jodie Subject RE IES Zone D DDVCs What was inferred by all was all of the stations listed on you spreadsheets that you provided in your email of that made reference to the fact that all of the stations listed for Octobers business that required PPAs would also require PPAs for November and December I assumed that these stations were the ones that we have issues with Thanks Gary Original Message From Zadow Raetta Sent Wednesday January PM To Anderson Gary E Cc Semin Frank Neubauer Dave Sebesta Chris Dietz Rick Blair Lynn Floyd Jodie Zadow Raetta Subject RE IES Zone D DDVCs Gary when you said that all December PPAs would be done by the th I think that we are all under the assumption that you mean all meters and not just the lists that we sent you that showed the four customers that we did for October Is that a correct assumption please let us know Thanks Raetta Original Message From Zadow Raetta Sent Wednesday January AM To Anderson Gary E Floyd Jodie Semin Frank Blair Lynn Neubauer Dave Cc Sebesta Chris Zadow Raetta Subject RE IES Zone D DDVCs Gary could you get a list of stations to Jodie or I for the ones that you have not received charts on yet so that we can see what kind of impact that would have on our customers invoices Thanks Raetta Original Message From Anderson Gary E Sent Wednesday January AM To Floyd Jodie Semin Frank Blair Lynn Neubauer Dave Cc Sebesta Chris Zadow Raetta Subject RE IES Zone D DDVCs Correction I reported that in the event that GMS could not process all Dec PPAs by the th we would mobilize personnel to process over the weekend to accommodate a special run that Raetta had indicated could be ran on the th to accommodate the Dec PPAs This should make us current on all PPAs with the exception of a few that we did not receive charts on Thanks Gary Original Message From Floyd Jodie Sent Wednesday January AM To Semin Frank Blair Lynn Neubauer Dave Anderson Gary E Cc Sebesta Chris Zadow Raetta Subject RE IES Zone D DDVCs Update Gary reported on that all charts excluding UCUare being read for the months of Nov Dec The chart reading will be complete no later than per GMS Gas Logistics ran PPAs the night of We should have some preliminary invoices later today to compare numbers If you have any questions please give Raetta or myself a call j floyd Original Message From Semin Frank Sent Thursday January PM To Floyd Jodie Blair Lynn Neubauer Dave Anderson Gary E Cc Sebesta Chris Subject FW IES Zone D DDVCs Importance High LynnJodie Is it possible to give IES and estimate of when we will have the December corrected Original Message From Sebesta Chris Sent Thursday January PM To Semin Frank Subject FW IES Zone D DDVCs Importance High FYI I would like to respond asap I thought we addressed metering problems at our meeting Specifically they would be getting adjustments How long will estimates be occurring I am going to refer Jeffs Historical Meter Data remarks to Larry Berger I am also going to remind Jeff that he was going to get back to us if he want any historical data prior to May Lets talk this PM so I can respond Original Message From Bill Zorr mailto Sent Thursday January PM To Jeff Hicken Cc Anita Archibold Kelly Schneider Subject Re IES Zone D DDVCs Keep me posted on NN responses to your concerns Jeff Hicken PM Chris December Invoice We just went through the December invoices and we incurred DDVCs on days in IES Zone D that we arent going to pay This total is When we looked through the statements we found that at least of the gates were estimated the last half of the month and all of our DDVCs occurred between and Of the estimated gates at least were large Zone D gates We were short on which was a warm day and long on and which were all cold days so they all fit the pattern of getting charged incorrectly for DDVC because of estimated data In addition we think you may have metering problems at two gates Rowley Vinton Rowley looks like it quit working intermittently during the month We have some metering ourselves that matches fairly well some days and is way off others and ours looks more correct Vinton matches our data pretty well for the first half of the month but in the last half of the month something looks wrong You flat lined the last half of the month but your total for that period is about of what we got Your metering group can contact Anita Archibold to get our data We only have data at four Zone D gates and half of those looked wrongscary We havent looked at Zone BC yet because we didnt get DDVCs but are planning too Historical Metering Data Your metering group did help me download data gate data for last winter to get historical use data electronically However I still dont have anything for the year before There are two problems however with the winter I did get The download works very inconsistently Sometimes you have to try many times to get the download to work You cant download the actual current data and get it in one report you can only download whatever was in the bill that month For instance if you want to know what the actual gate station use was for Dec you would first download that month The problem is you wont get any data from corrections that occurred later and in this case I know that at the very least the Cherokee gate was off by a factor of ten That means that I also have to download many months after that and search all of those to find any corrections to a particular meter and cut and paste the data into the original download Its an ugly process to say the least and its one I really dont have time to do On the positive side my first couple of contacts with our new rep Karen have been good and thanks for your tip that Demarc could get allocated Jeff Jeff Hicken Gas Trader AlliantEnergy
